intro: Mentzelia hintoniorum, commonly known as Hinton's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. It produces small, achene-like seeds that are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in desert scrub and grassland environments. Mentzelia hintoniorum is a perennial herb that thrives in arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
